resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
lidavidm opened a new pull request, #14231:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14231

   The check doesn't add much value, and makes things flaky because whether a branch is covered or not can come down to chance based on where exactly an exception occurs.

lwhite1 commented on PR #14231:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14231#issuecomment-1258026773

   What's the connection between JaCoCo and the JDK8 and JDK9+ profiles?

lidavidm commented on PR #14231:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14231#issuecomment-1258130189

   We used to have to pass more options to Surefire to get JaCoCo to work, so we had to duplicate some of the test config (since JDK8/9+ require different Surefire options). Now that we're not using JaCoCo, we also don't need that config, so we can simplify it

lwhite1 commented on PR #14231:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14231#issuecomment-1258237452

   > We used to have to pass more options to Surefire to get JaCoCo to work, so we had to duplicate some of the test config (since JDK8/9+ require different Surefire options). Now that we're not using JaCoCo, we also don't need that config, so we can simplify it
   
   Makes sense.

fields.description: It doesn't seem to bring much value + can make builds flaky (e.g. a branch may or may not be hit depending on when exactly an exception occurs)
fields.summary: [Java] Remove flaky JaCoCo check in JDBC driver
